newsitem.title: USA: Cushman & Wakefield to buy firm from Prudential.
newsitem.headline: Cushman & Wakefield to buy firm from Prudential.

text.p: Cushman & Wakefield, an international real estate services firm, said Monday it has signed a letter of intent to acquire Premisys Real Estates Services Inc from Prudential Insurance Co of America.
Terms of the proposed deal were not disclosed.
Cushman said when completed, the transaction will expand its third-party asset servies management portfolio to over 200 million square feet worldwide, from 140 million square feet.
Premisys is a Houston-based property management and leasing services, with a nationwide portfolio of 65 million square feet of office, industrial and residential properties.

The properties include those held in Prudential's $5.5 billion so-called general account which are held on behalf of policyholders, including many of Prudential's own coprorate facilities and properties owned by third parties.
Premisys, formed in 1989, currently employs more than 1,000 people.
